Now if we go again I may not even order a piece of cheesecake which is the main reason why I love to go. What a shame.....

Don't get me wrong, I am a die hard fan of the Cheesecake Factory and would lay my life down for just a bite of their decadent cakes, but this particular one has left me jaded and skeptical of ever going back.  It was a night like any other, I had just left the movies and had placed an order for pickup. After a tub of bland popcorn, I relished the idea of tearing into the sumptuous bounty that is chicken alfredo and sun dried tomatoes. I finally get home and am about to eat my dinner, when much to my chagrin, the unthinkable happened.  Instead of the creamy, rich meal I had expected, I was given plain noodles with no sauce, only olive oil, and a spoonful of cold, bland, tomatoes. My life flashed before my eyes as I forced myself to take a bite, and let me just say - the only thing seasoning this dish was the salt provided by my woeful tears.

Came here for some quick dessert! Sat at the bar with no problem!  Bartenders were quick and easy to talk to even with a big crowd.  I suggest trying or ordering the Banana Cream cheese cake! Nice, light, and refreshing!
Great meal. Chicken Madeira is unreal.  Cheesecake was the best part that's kind of a given.  Our waitress Barbara was very pleasant.

Such a yummy meal! I was visiting from the UK - I started with the fried mozzarella sticks, then for mains I had spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered a white chocolate and raspberry cheesecake. I also ordered a pina colada. The cocktail was lovely, it was so refreshing! The fried cheese was so tasty and moreish, the spaghetti and meatballs was so tasty, I actually had some leftover so I brought it back to my hotel, the cheesecake was so good!!! I enjoyed it a lot! I cannot wait to return, after a busy day at the Town Center Mall is was so nice to have such a great meal, and to unwind and relax. Cannot wait to return!

If I could give no stars....tasteless chicken, reheated mash potatoes and wilted asparagus.  It was supposed to come with a lemon sauce...no taste..white liquid.   Cheesecake has gone majorly downhill.  We won't be back.

Waited for a fair amount of time, but not too long considering that it was a saturday night. Our server tried hard, but just couldnt keep up. Seemed like we never had drinks and we were always still needing some side or something missing. Food was good overall.

We had a great time here as always.  We sat at the bar.  The bartender did great job and the food was good too. We had Vietnamese  shrimp summer rolls, everything pizza and tuna carpaccio. We were too full to have cheese cake.  Although there was an employee who talked very loud which bothered our time a bit but yet we still give them 5 stars cause we like their food and service at the bar.

Well let me say it was an un pleasant expierence. I ordered Factory Meatloaf it came to the table burnt. It was horrible. My cousin ordered a side Cesar salad the dressing has no taste and was watery. The wait staff had no personality. Very disappointing.

Very slow ..we waited 25m for the bread and another 25m for our food, servers are nice the host at the front not so nice..she was in a rash to answer her phone call and didn't notice we are 4 and not 3!

The food is amazing as usual at any Cheesecake Factory but the service was horrible. We were sat around 6:30 on a Monday night and it took our server, Christian almost 20 minutes to even stop at our table. I ordered for myself and my son and he started walking away before taking my husbands order - then, surprise, surprise our appetizer never came. The place is more than half empty so there really is no reason for a server to be so overwhelmed. We will defiantly be back to a Cheesecake Factory in the future - we love it - but probably not this location.

After having dinner there many times I thought it was just okay, I had a chicken dish which was overcooked and the broccoli was very hard, much to al la dente.  Will only go back to the Grand Lux .  No comparison.  Much more upscale  Worth the extra dollar

Made a reservation for a party of 12 over the weekend. They squeezed us in to a table for 8 people. Didn't have enough servers. Took us over hours by the time the food came. Should have went somewhere else when we saw how small the table was. They shouldn't take reservations for a big group if they can't handle it. My order was wrong too. Totally disappointed

Me and my old roommates came here for a birthday dinner and it was quite enjoyable.  The serving sizes are noteworthy... the appetizers were big enough to share. I had the buffalo blasts and they were delicious.  Our server was attentive and knowledgeable of the menu options and etc.  The piece d'resistance is the cheesecake... sooo many options... each one tastier and more tempting than the next.  Recommend this place for a nice sit down dinner or even to grab a slice of cheesecake after a long hard day...  Parking is a bit difficult at peak hours... Valet is an option as well..

Save yourself the trouble and DO NOT come here on a Sunday between 11 and 3. Service is lacking and your food will take FOREVER. My waiter got my order wrong this afternoon then decided to give me attitude and confront me when I complained to the manager about it. There went your tip, buddy.

Very disappointed. We arrived for a reservation and waited fifteen minutes, which was not too bad. We were seated and half the drinks were brought ten minutes later. The waiter showed up about 20 minutes later let us know he had 5 tables sit all at once. We gave an appetizer order right away with  that news.The rest of the drinks arrived about 15 minutes later. We then placed our orders knowing we probably wouldn't see much of him.30 minutes after that our apps showed up. Within 1-2 minutes our dinners then showed up. Out of 6 of us only 1 person enjoyed the meal. We probably should have the manager come over and see our un eaten plates, but we were celebrating a birthday and didn't want to spoil our time together.  I must say this is the 2nd time Recently I have experienced a long wait for below average service and poorly prepared food. I don't think I'll be going back based on the last 2 visits.

I'm done with the Cheesecake Factory! I ordered A beef dip it was disgusting! Don't know if it was maybe the cheese. I brought half home since I would eat for dinner. NOT! The dog got it  filled with grizzle ! Then they charged me $3 for seltzer! If I knew that I would have had water!!!  This was called a 2 cents plain & cost  2 cents what a rip off ! And please clean that discusting woman's bathroom I'll never know cuz I'm never coming back!

No reservations taken, even for lrg birthday event. Very nice server but service was slow. The food runner knocked over my glass of wine n shattered on the table. No manager visible at all. Would be nice to be checked on. Forgot how big the portions are. Appetizers are not needed.

Cheesecake factory has a great happy hour with discounted drinks and appetizers. We were a little late but they let us have the cheaper price. The food and beer was delicious. The waiter was very helpful in suggesting which beer was lighter and which appetizers were the largest helpings. We had a great time.
Food was terrible, overcooked and not worth the money. The bill came to over $70 for 2 people and no alcoholic drinks. The cheesecake was also bad.
Came in with my daughter for lunch.  Great casual environment  and turkey club sandwich was amazing.  We'll be back for Sunday brunch.

We went in around 4:45pm & got seated immediately, the service was great and the food even better. As in any other cheese cake factory the later you go the longer you'll have to wait because by the time we left which was about 6:30 there was a line waiting to be seated.... But I'm sure it's worth the wait if you go after 5pm :)

Decent Cheesecake Factory. I tried the tortilla soup that was alright, nothing special. They have recently added an extensive gluten free menu which was perfect for my celiac friend! It had pages which is super unique. The service was amazing here, they also gave my party free cheesecakes which really made my day. The food is regular Cheesecake Factory quality and has something for everyone. It always looks super busy but the wait is rarely more than 40 minutes each time I've been there.

For being a chain restaurant The Cheesecake Factory rarely disappoints. The menu is huge, but we've discovered that their chicken dishes are the best.  Today we tried the meatloaf which was a bust and the Chicken Di Panna which was delicious. We shared a soup which I cannot recall the name and we could not find room for dessert. The service was friendly and the prices are decent.    There is one thing that I will never understand, why do restaurants serve warm bread with frozen butter? How can something so basic be overlooked by many restaurants not just the Cheesecake Factory. Anyhow I must say I really love their strawberry lemonade and the raspberry lemonade isn't bad either. Overall it's a safe place to eat if you don't want to be disappointed.

Salad was so yummy. Fresh crisp veggies. The taco lettuce wraps were excellent as well. Hubby had the Mac and cheese burger and I didn't hear a word from him until it was gone so safe to say he loved it. We ordered the white chocolate cheesecake truffle for dessert and it was amazing! Definitely recommend.

Went with a buddy late night dinner. Ordered mediera chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies. Went traditional. Been to this location few times. The service is lacking severely. The food was good.  We had to wait half hour to order. disappointed in the service.

Food is pretty good and portion sizes are generally obscene.   There's typically a wait. Service; however, is HIT or MISS.  The desserts are to die for, their brown bread is also amazeballs.  I love their skinnylicious menu all items under 550 calories, but they only report calories...even on their website...so you can't see fat grams or sodium.  Kind of annoying, wish they would report everything in totality.

This was a great place to take family from out of town. My daughter always enjoys their food from the kids menu. I love the Greek salad and the ahi tuna. My uncle had the meatloaf my aunt had chicken Wings we had strawberry cheesecake. My mother had the grilled salmon she was so happy. The waitress did her job well. She came to the table and asked if we need anything she kept coming by to check on us. We had an awesome time and service here and the food was great. The sauce, the ingredients, how the food was cooked was well done I would like to say "thank you" to the kitchen manager Oliver.

You can see from my review history a restaurant or other biz really needs to fail bad to motivate me to write negatively (see City Mattress and Boca Ale House).  Our server Tyler is exonerated because he did a great job and the issues are not his fault.  The two major complaints are how far the food has gone down hill and the seating with tables and chairs  basically on top of each other.  First the bad chow- the grande burrito is not so grande anymore as only 2/3 of the burrito wrap had filling and both ends were empty.  There was maybe a spec of chicken and the cilantro rice wasn't cooked so it was teeth breaking hard.  The shrunken portion/poorly cooked theme held true for the whole table with a couple other low lights being brown guacamole and bone dry chicken tenders.  I didn't expect much from the Cheesecake Factory in the first place but they really went out of their way to under impress.  As far as the communal seating I am not into invasion of personal space and was creeped out the whole meal by the strangers within inches of my family.   Just like the Ale House it used to be great and then the corners get cut...a shame.

I've been coming here for a while and it's a pretty good restaurant. I've heard a lot of bad reviews about this establishment but I've always left as a satisfied customer. The entrees are great and the cheesecake is even better.

I was visiting Boca Raton on vacation and while I was there, I ate at the Cheesecake Factory. I had pasta witch grilled chicken, it was delicious. The server was nice and funny. He greeted us and helped us decide what we should get. The service all in all was fantastic and our food came out pretty quick. The portions are extremely large and even though it is a little pricey the Cheesecake Factory is a perfect restaurant for a special occasion.  Of course we had to get cheesecake for dessert! It tasted great and was huge! I couldn't have been happier with my experience at this location and will definitely go back the next time I'm in Boca Raton. I would highly recommend it and make sure you are ready to eat when you go there

The staff here are perhaps the most unfriendly people I have ever met in my entire life. Unsure if there is a full moon but ownership and management should be ashamed of themselves for allowing their employees to treat their customers the way they do. We called ahead at around 9 am the morning of and asked to place a reservation for four. They told me they do not do reservations unless it's a party of six or more. Well, I asked if we will have any issues getting a table and was told we would not. So, we arrived at 6:30 and for a party for a four, needed to wait a half hour for a table. I had then walked up to the front desk and asked for a booth because of a handy cap in our party. The only reason why this place did not receive a one star review (or even none, if that was possible) was because of our server. He was very attentive, friendly and conversed with us. He was very good at his job and that is why he had saved this restaurant from what would have been a bomb of a review. Will I be back here? No. Simple as that.

I love the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes! My brother had introduced me to them and they're always a great appetizer.  This is a great place to go when your hungry with big portions to everything. The service is good, and sometimes you have to wait a while at this particular location.

I've been to The Cheesecake Factory several times and it's a little too "commercial" for my taste. I prefer to dine a restaurants that are local, fresh, homemade, and all all that is in between. I find that the food at cheesecake is made in bulk to serve the large audience and it just doesn't come out great. I ordered the salmon salad and it wasn't even cooked all the way. Not only are all of the dishes here ridiculously unhealthy (even the ones on the low cal menu, check it out), they just aren't made with "love". I feel like they are just slopped together with a high price tag and called gourmet. Especially after this trip, I'm not a fan.

I've been to Cheesecake Factory before in other states but have not visited this location since we moved here 6  months ago. We had Jeremy G as a waiter and he made our Friday night experience dining out perfect. The food and portions were great. Actually I had to take 1\2 my meal home. He was very conscientious and knew just the right time to come by and see us.  The

The Cheesecake Factory by far has the best Roadside Sliders.  Another delicious dish to get is the factory nachos. By far the best nacho's out there.  Great service. Definitely great for the whole family.

I avoided Cheesecake Factory's when I lived in California because I thought all they served was cheesecake...and I was really confused why people always flocked there for dinner.   I eventually went to one in Huntington Beach (I should probably write a review) and fell in love with it.  It was the first time I'd ever had a sweet potato fry.  I didn't even know there was such a thing. But I've been to this one about four times now and it's always been a good time.  Granted, it's Boca and I'm not a huge fan of the people in west Boca because I have yet to see someone smile or wave and that's why I enjoy restaurants in Boca, because they HAVE TO wave and be nice!  It's like you see a whole new side of this city...the friendly side :) The nachos are the best.  The are regular old nachos like I used to make in junior high when I would get home from school and watch Duck Tales.  Big chips, cheese, jalapenos, sour cream, and salsa.  Pretty basic but good.   I can't recall the name of it but I get the cheeseburger piled high with onion straws and barbecue sauce.  It's always to die for.  Never had a complaint here.  The best part of the meal is the ultimate margarita.  I think that's what they call it here.  It's the premium one with good tequila.  I always feel that when they say ultimate it will be like Chevy's where you can enjoy it for more than three straw-pulls but they just mean good tequila.  Either way, it's good.  If they enlarged the glass it went in it would be even better.   Definitely check this Cheesecake Factory out when in Boca, if for nothing else, do it to see entitled people SMILE!

My husband and I enjoy going here for Happy Hour.  On Mondays through Fridays, in the bar, they have discounted drinks and appetizers.  The bar has comfortable booths and hi-top tables and chairs. We get a cocktail and order a few different  appetizers to share.  Their appetizers are delicious. Their regular menu has so many choices.  There's something for everybody.  I love their pasta dishes.

What an enjoyable birthday dinner we had here last night for one of my in-laws.  Not only did we get seated promptly with the mad crowd during prime dinner hour, but the service was great.  We weren't in a rush and our server was very knowledgeable with the menu.  I settled for the chicken romano, which is baked chicken with a parmesan cheese crust and lot of angel hair pasta with tomato sause.  The plate was enough to fill up three people and I could only fill up so much up on it until I had to stop for a piece of red velvet cheesecake.  Remember to save room for a piece of cheesecake.  You won't be sorry!

It appears that food quality is no longer priority number one at Cheesecake Factory.  Twice in a row my meal has been downright pathetic.  It's a shame, as we've considered them for many years to be at the high end of the chain restaurants, above a TGI Friday's or a Chili's. In the restaurant's defense, let me say that the cleanliness and ambiance were everything they always have been, and on both occasions my wife thought her meal was almost up to par with CF's usual standards. The first time, I had the Mac & Cheese Burger.  The mac & cheese was dried out and flavorless.  The burger was cooked to my liking, but must have sat waiting way too long to be picked up by the server, as it was only room temperature by the time it reached our table.  The meat was also dry.  To top it all off,  the bun was stale.  It was the first time ever at CF that I couldn't finish the whole meal, because it was just no good. The second time, last night, I ordered Fish Tacos.  Our server asked if I would like the fish broiled or crispy.  I asked if the crispy fish was deep fried.  He said no, it just has a light tempura batter that makes it crispy.  So crispy is how I ordered it.  When it showed up, it had clearly been deep fried, which I pointed out to the server, and he said "yes, of course," like we had never had the first conversation at all.  It was also immediately obvious that $14 for four very tiny fish tacos is an unbelievable rip off.  Taco Bell sells better looking food!  As soon as I picked up the first one of these tiny little tacos, the flour tortilla broke into four or five pieces because it was so dried out.  The diced over-ripe tomatoes had obviously come from a container that had a lot of water in it, and that made the texture of the dried out tortilla seem very runny, cheap, and utterly disgusting.  They need to take this item off the menu, and never bring it back. Tonight we ate at Pollo Tropical, and I must say the quality of the food was far superior to the crap I had last night at Cheesecake Factory!

A half hour after placing our food order, we were told that they were out of batter and that my brother was going to have to pick a new food item.  When I asked how long before his food was ready would the rest of ours come out the waiter quickly said that ours was ready now, but that it would sit and wait to come out with my brother's new meal.  We were told it would be another 7 minutes, but it really took about 15-20.  My mom ordered the California omelet which came out missing the avocado.  She was almost finished by the time they brought out a few slices.  The manager did come around finally to ask us about the missing avocado, but had no idea about my brother's food or that we had to wait forever.  After all that they didn't comp anything or provide any sort of discount or anything.  The food was bland on top of all of that.

Cheesecake Factory ruins Mother's Day. They have open tables. Yet refused to combine an empty table at the end of our table to accommodate our large party. The waitress embarrassed me in front of my family and made us cram together. SO GREEDY! Factory is the correct name. Cram the guests in to make money!  Just totally ruined my time with my family. Thanks Cheesecake Factory for nothing.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a safe choice when you need to go out to dinner with a large group of people that you don't know well-- as others have pointed out, the menu is very extensive and has something for everyone. The avocado eggrolls appetizer is my favorite! Sometimes I just order that as my main dinner! The sauce that comes with it is delicious! If you're a fan of avocado, you'll love this, really. It's one of my favorite things on the entire menu. The Crispy Chicken Costoletta is my favorite chicken dish! Fried, breaded chicken with lemon-butter sauce with a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes. So good! So many calories! Definitely worth it. The buffalo chicken strips are really good, too. It's weird to order chicken strips from such a large menu, but they're probably one of the best I've had. Moist and delicious! The bistro shrimp pasta is my definite recommendation if you're in the mood for shrimp and pasta!! In terms of food quality, they never disappoint; everything is very well-made and service is great. Overall, it's an American chain, so don't expect any sort of culinary elation while dining here. However, it's a safe choice for a decent dinner for a large group or a quick lunch between classes. Just beware that their dishes usually land on those "most caloric" lists nationwide!! (They claim their portions are meant to be eaten as 2 separate meals...right!)
Wait was a longer than they said but food is delicious as always! Especially the new s'mores cheesecake! Delicious!!!!

Went here for lunch today and it is a mad house.  It took over 20 minutes to get drinks and forget the food, I was beginning to doubt that it would ever come.  They were not apologetic at about the wait and other tables they sat after us had food way before we did.  The food was ok nothing remarkable.

First off this is not a dig against Cheesecake Factory, we eat at every location we can find and we leave satisfied.  However, there's always an exception to the rule and the CF on 5530 Glades in Boca Raton is the exception.   I ordered the shepherds pie and my wife got the beef colette.  My shepherds pie was scalding hot so I waited for it to cool while my wife sawed her way through her steak.  I say sawed because it was a very tough steak and lacked flavor.   Once I got into my SP I was unimpressed with the preparation, it looked like a minute steak which was sliced and doused with gravy and topped with the unremarkable mashed potato's and a smattering of vegetables.  It was like eating the equivalent of onion soup, just thicker.  The next day I had a stomach ache and a brief bout of diarrhea. The restaurant like all CF's is outrageously noisy, the service was poor, rushed and unfriendly. We aren't going back, we'll look for another location.

How can anyone NOT love this place. Seriously, the menu is like a book, the food is awesome and comes in HUGE portions and the cheesecakes are the best. Bring the entire family as this place has everything. A secret time to visit is Sunday for Brunch (before noon) and the food is way better than other breakfast places and the price is the same.
This Cheesecake Factory is really small and food is always great I love the staff and bakery employees.

I love the miso salmon dish! I order it almost every time I come here because it never fails. My girlfriend ordered the pizza for the first time. She has been wanting to try it for a long time and was glad she finally did. The portions are large, cheesecakes are delicious, and the service is great.

Mixed review tonight. Salmon -excellent. Bang Bang chicken & shrimp - not so good, (3 tiny shrimp, overcooked pasty rice) Spicy Cashew Chicken- not so good, (same pasty rice, overcooked chicken, tasted reheated), Big chicken salad - good. We've come for years but this is now the second time that consistancy was poor, it will be a long while before we try again.

On August 1, 2016 we had dinner with another couple at the Boca Raton, FL, Cheesecak Factory. We ate on the top floor of the ramp. Did you know that the air conditioner wasn't working up there? We live in Florida and the outside air temperature was 95 degrees....along with humidity it feels like 105 degrees. Halfway through dinner my husband had to leave the table because he couldn't breathe. He sat on a bench downstairs by the cheesecake cooler and waited for us to finish. We finished quickly. We were very uncomfortable and did not have an enjoyable dinner. My husband, Al, spoke to a female manager who did not seem to care. Your General Manger, Don Cortese, was not there or my husband was told he was not there. This was our friends first time at Cheesecake. Guess they won't be back either. The bottom floor was cool..........why weren't we moved down there. No one should be sitting where there is no air conditioning.

The Cheesecake Factory has set the 5-star rating standards for every restaurant, everywhere; and their consistency is key! 1. free warm bread- multigrain or sourdough 2. appetizers- buffalo blasts, mex eggrolls, calamari just to name a few 3. entrees- salads, pizzas, award winning mushroom burger, chicken madeira, steak diane, shrimp scampi everything is yummy!!  4. deserts- chocolate cake, godiva cheesecake, every kind of cheesecake imaginable! All deserts, not just cheesecakes are awesome!!! 5. service/ambiance- beautiful! Clean! Attentive Sunday brunch is served till 2pm and features the greatest sandwich ever invented...the Monte Cristo! Ham, egg, bacon, and cheese squeezed between french toast topped with powdered sugar and a side of strawberry preserves and hash browns! Perfection on a dish! The pancakes and waffles are pretty good too but only served on Sunday.  Martini's are hand-crafted and muddled to order. I LOVE the strawberry martini and the lemon drop. One drink, all vodka, will give you the buzz you are looking for when you order a martini. Steer away from Sangria, it was too juicy and pre-made. This place is always packed but well worth the wait. Coming here is always a treat!

This Cheesecake Factory is just like any other. It is a great place to come with either family or friends. The food is great, the portions are enormous. The prices are good for what you get. One of my personal favorite dishes is the caramel chicken. It is always good at any time of year. But i always keep a place near my heard for the miso salmon. From the sweet butter sauce to the tenderness of the salmon. It is amazing. To think such a succulent dish could come out of this place. There are plenty of choices for everyone. I swear the menu seems to contain four hundred pages of meal choices. There is something for everyone here. I would give it five stars but the drinks aren't that great. I ordered a mojito and they seemed to have understood lemonade with crushed mint. This is not the first time this happened. Still i wont get deterred from coming back for more... Oh and make sure you try the avocado eggrolls as an appetizer so good!!! Also do not come here if you're on any kind of diet. Big mistake.

The service has turned horrific  the man waiters are only interested in flirting with the female waitresses also customers they play this game  over and over and laugh about it the staff is a bunch of teenagers the food can be good but make sure you get a server who was mature by the way my daughters spaghetti and meatballs had one meatball

I didn't get to each cheesecake because I was full from all the food. The food was great, the service was fast. We were a group of 6 and had three waiters bring out our food at the same time. The thai lettuce wraps were phenomenal, the soup of the day (Mexican soup) was very hearty. I would come here again.

Sooooo disappointing!  Our group of six stopped in for late night coffee and cake, but left very sorry we did.  First the table was set with some noticeably unclean dishes and the banquette had salad tucked between the cushion and the wall.  UGH!!!   Then the iced and regular decafs were made with undrinkable overly strong, burnt coffee.  Even the replacement cappuccinos and soda were tasteless and worthless.  Two pieces of cheesecake proved to be tasty, but the apple crisp had almost no "crisp", only baked apple slices and ice cream in a syrup.   Our coffee and cake outing turned into a mediocre dessert and water evening.  It took discussion with two managers to get any relief on the bill.  We should not have had to ask - it should have been automatic for a manager to simply delete the check when so much has gone wrong and six people are visibly upset about their experience in your restaurant.   This place may be a big chain, but that doesn't give them the right to take advantage and abuse customers - even ones who'll never go back again.

You know what you're getting at the Cheesecake Factory. Like any chain if you have been to one then you know what to expect. HOWEVER they have removed the portbello burger from the menu and this was one of my faves. Luckily you have plenty of other menu items to choose from but....I will miss the portobello.

I've only been there once, and I will probably come back again. Just felt like I was a bit overwhelmed with the atmosphere of this place which I could literally NOT stop looking around the murals and mosaic on the walls and everything else! The food was amazing and we didn't get dessert.... even though we were in a CHEESECAKE heaven. But next time, I will!  Since this is in Boca and right next to the Town Center Mall... I kind of feel underdressed coming out to this side of town cause a lot of the people, especially women, seem to be brash with their own thing. But whatever, if you have a bunch of great people with you- it won't matter.

I would have liked to include a photo here but the website of this chain doesn't avail you of many - except for cheesecakes. I'm into food, not desserts, and I definitely haven't been to that place for dessert - so here goes. I was freaked out by the Cheesecake Factory in Houston many years ago and didn't return. For some reason I ventured into their Boca Raton location some time ago. (The reason for the freak out? The Houston locataion was playing opera music, which I TOTALLY detest. And they were quite unapologetic/accomodating about it. So I steered clear for many years.) Moving on - the Boca Raton location has been a wonderful find for me. Not only do I like their food but the decor is magical. See their website for more details - but basically, art deco, wonderful. Their Boca location is also huge, and most often very full! Quite a feat to pull off. Last Sunday I visited and got my usual - a massive Cobb Salad that really would be big enough for two meals, but it's so delicious I always finish it (and don't eat dinner). Accompanied by a Blue Moon and warm brown bread - delicious. This time around I noticed a lot of things on the menu I'd definitely like to try, like three types of cooked salmon in one dish! In fact the menu is so eclectic I thought it might be a good place to take a date to, despite the fact that because of it's vastness I'd more considered the Cheesecake Factory of more a cafe type place. But that kind of menu can inspire some serious eating. I should have asked if they have a wine list. I guess so. Lastly they played very muted jazz music - wonderful! Definitely a place I like returning to.

Hmmm where do I start?!?!? They have a huge variety of food choices to choose from like 15-16 pages! They have an amazing fried zucchini with ranch dressing..... Which if I might say so is heavenly... Lol!!!! Tonight I ordered off the"skinny menu" trying to watch my calories of course and i got the beef tips with mashed potatoes, tomatoes, asparagus, and mushrooms. Can you say delicious? Lol you wouldn't know it was a healthier choice since it tasted so good I finished my entire plate. They have yummy alcoholic drinks I had a tropical martini that'l was so good. Now I'm not a huge cheese cake lover (I know who goes to the Cheesecake Factory if u don't like cheesecake?!?!) well I've tried a few, but my favorite is the Godiva chocolate  cheesecake.... Can I just say that it is heavenly? My other favorite one is their pumpkin cheesecake but you can only get that in the fall :( so sad!!!! I've tried many foods here and have enjoyed each and every single one.... This is a place for the pickiest eater since they have so many choices to eat from! Pricing is decent can be high but the amount of food you get it is totally worth it!
Food is always great! The only problem was the service sucked! And the wait time is ridiculous.

Huge plates !!!   The Factory makes everybody happy.  My go to meal here is Chicken and Biscuits add Biscuit / have them grill chicken. This is also combined with a Mai Tai and followed up with the Best Godiva Cheesecake in town ! Enjoy.

I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 out of the goodness of my heart. I LOVE Cheesecake Factory but this location is awful. Worst I've ever been too. Service is horribly slow and I've found foreign objects In my food on 2 separate occasions.
It's ok. I've always liked CF just not the wait.

This location sucks. The one in Pembroke Pines, Sunrise, & out of state locations that I've been to are MUCH better. I've been to this location multiple times and every single time our waiter is missing in action, nowhere to be found, never good service, have had our food delivered to the wrong table after waiting an hour TWICE. What restaurant does that twice in a row? This one does. The only thing good is the cheesecake, but it's not worth everything else you'll have to endure. I wouldn't recommend the Boca location. One manager is nice, the other is rude. But it's Boca, did I really expect someone in Boca to be nice? not really. Next.

Standard food. Poor service. Server placed appetizer dish on top of the butter plate knocking the butter packets all onto the table and just walked away. They forgot my dressing on the side and served my dates salad with tomatoes even though be specifically requested none. They didn't offer fresh ground pepper to me after grinding some for him.  I still gave it 3 stars because the food arrived quickly.

Why do decent restaurants always seem to go downhill after a spell?!? Food was Okay.... quality definitely not match price. Entree of $19.95 of $8.95 quality. I ordered the 'premium' margarita and it was served in a tall thin glass with waaay too much ice. Could not taste any tequila. Stupidly, I asked for a second (with tequila, this time!) and it was the same as the first. When we received the bill each margarita was $14 !!! That is $28 for some syrup and ice.... not much tequila, if any. So for two people it ran $100, which I don't mind if the value is there. It wasn't! I will not be returning. (The two star rating is taking into account their desserts and decor. 0 stars for food and value.)
Took forever for them to bring food. Waited for more than an hour. Asked for mustard which arrived after the food was almost over. Bland food.

No standardization here.  We both ordered the Cobb Salad with dressing on the side.  The two salads looked different when placed infront of us.  My friend's portion was larger and encircled by crumbled bits of cheese.  The smaller salad placed infront of me did not appear to have cheese and looked wet.   I assumed the cheese was underneath and the wetness was probably the dressing which I had requested be on the side.  Wrong on both counts.  There was no cheese and there was no dressing on the salad or on the side.  The wetness was wilted salad.  I gaged trying to eat it.  I kept thinking they took someone's leftover salad and served it to me. I'm grossed out  just thinking about it.  I normally get the Carlton salad, so at the time I didn't realize my Cobb salad was also missing the chicken.   I'll need time to forget that salad before I can go back.

It all started with the hostess, my grandmother left her number with her. Hostess said the table will be ready in 20 mins. 25 mins later we walk in asking about our table and the host says they tried calling us two times. We never got a call. At that time is was my brother and grandmother an the host sat my grandmother as my grandma sat. When the rest of us came from right out side the host just smiled and the host that was seating my grandma was down the hall holding hands with somebody else. Needless to say we found our own way to the table with grandma flagging us down. But this isn't the worst part.  Food was as usual, great, as all the cheesecake factories. Food was not the issue; the waitress was, terrible service! We sat down after a 30 min wait and got bombarded with what drink we wanted. (As if she was a drill Sargent, ok you! Now you! Next) we asked her if she was in a hurry and she stated that she has to bring one table drinks and cater another. (Not that big of a deal if you ask me, 3 tables) same with meals, drill Sargent when asking. When we asked for bread for the third time we decided to ask another waitress for bread which took less than 2 mins to to receive. Thank god my brother asked to speak to the manager to inform him of his horrendous worker and he brought us a new waitress.  Our new waitress had a much better attitude, but was seen very seldom. Took 15 mins for her to come back after she gave us the check

This is one of those places that you become "obsessed" with when you move to Florida.  At least that was the case with me, and my family and friends, maybe because we didn't have Cheesecake Factory where we lived before. This is the place you take everyone who's visiting you, for lunch or dinner and then they go back home and tell all their friends they've been to the Cheesecake Factory.  I guess the fact that they have so many types of cheesecakes is a big deal, plus they have a very extensive menu, something for everyone, so you know even the pickiest eater in your party will find something here. After living in FL for almost 11 years, the novelty has passed - actually it passed years ago - and I hadn't eaten from here in a long time.  But today, for a business meeting, we ordered from here and I started remembering what I started saying here. This is still a great restaurant.  I love their Cobb Salad, it's always fresh and a very generous portion. Haven't had their cheesecake in years but still remember how yummy they are, my favorite is the Banana Cream Cheesecake.  Will have to skip dinner one day and go straight for that  :p

TIRAMISU TIRAMISU TIRAMISU!!! Their cheese cake is probably the best thing I have tasted in South Florida! I've tried the Teriyaki steak and it's pretty good, I got it Med Rare and w/ mashed potatoes.  They gave me a large portion of potatoes and I was full before I even ordered desert! They used to have really good ribs that had meat fall off the bone, but they took that  off the menu! :( Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because they took my ribs off the menu!
You know what to expect and it always lives up to expectations... Good food and lots of it - a bit noisy but, hey - that's why you're there!

We went to the Cheesecake Factory for an early lunch/brunch on Sunday. I've never in my life had better pancakes than what we had at the Cheesecake Factory. I was extremely impressed as I was not expecting an excellent breakfast dish. But it is after all the Cheesecake Factory, everything seems to be great! Very impressed with the breakfast/brunch on Sundays.

Went here the other day with my wife and her family. The place was clean and considering we were a party of 8 we only waited about 5 min for a table. The place seemed clean and the waitress was ok but could of been better. I ordered the factory burrito which is very huge but very good. My wife and I split the red velvet cheesecake which was also good. You really can't go here and not get cheesecake to me it would be a crime not to do so lol. My wife and I were treated to the dinner so I can't say if the prices are good or not

The hostess was pretty rude. Didn't turn around cause she was clearly in love with one of the servers that. He had to greet and sit us. Food and service was just fine, as usual. Still one of my favorite places.

It's the cheesecake factory, you know what you're getting. The most fattening food selections that are huge portions and are delicious. Their wheat bread is awesome, I ask for a basket of just that without the sourdough. Salads are huge and taste very fresh, really love the sante fe salad or bbq chicken ranch salad. Can't really go wrong with any dish here and of course they have some of the best cheesecakes for dessert.

The food here is always reliably good. The humongous menu ensures that everybody can find something they like. I appreciate that even when there are a ton of people dining here, the service is quick and attentive. Best things to order: chicken Madeira, steak Diane, and the peanut butter cheesecake. The whiskey smash is a great drink with Bulleit bourbon.

This is probably the best managed Cheesecake Factory I've been to. Despite an incredibly busy Friday evening, once we sat down we were served promptly. The waiters provided exceptional and timely service. The food at the Boca Cheesecake location was also prepared more quickly and was much tastier than most of the Cheesecake's I've been to. Highly recommend.

Sorry but to me Cheesecake Factory has gone way down hill. There is nothing like a good salad, but when Cheesecake factory uses prewashed mixed salad that is all dried out and low quality all I can say is I hate chain restaurants. Seems everything is premade,precut, and prewashed. There is no taste like they extracted all the nutrients out of the food. The Santa Fe salad is half the price and Chipotle across the street, with better quality ingredients.

Curb side delivery took 55 minutes, I ordered at 3:45 when the restaurant was extremely slow, showed up 20 minutes after I placed the order and was told someone would be out in a minute. Called back after waiting 20 minutes. 5 minutes later a woman came out and took my credit card then another 10 minutes for her to return with my food and receipt. When I received my food it was cold. I would have walked in to complain but I have a leg injury, that's why I did curb side delivery.

Raw pancake batter. Sent pancakes back. Second order was worse. See photo. Fried eggs soaked in butter. Manager comped my meal. This is the second time Cheesecake Factory ruined my meal...last time was a few months ago on Las Olas. This poor quality is why I frequent local eateries as opposed to chains.
Came to get take out. People on the phone were so unfriendly, really disappointing. They couldn't have been clearer that they didn't care for the client.  Food is still good
Expensive but very good and always a pleasant experience. Cocktails are awesome. Almost as sinful as the cheesecake!!

Cheesecake Factory is consistent and good. I love the Mac and cheese balls and chicken littles!  Passion fruit iced tea is amazing. I'm usually too full for dessert but I've had the chocolate cake which is awesome. I know I know no cheesecake at Cheesecake Factory.... Give the chocolate cake a chance it doesn't disappoint!

Good old "Cheesecake Factory".  Tried this location and not much to say because you know you can get just about anything you want here, and you'll get enough to feed a small army. My recommendation is that if you want consistent (warm) food, services that is just okay, and a "wait" to get a table or your food then this is your place ... but on the positive side, they do have "great" Cheesecake at a $$$. (duh) Cheers!

Oh how the mighty have fallen. It almost brings a tear to my eyes to admit this but Cheesecake is not at all what it used to be. Still good for their staple apps like chicken pot stickers and Tex Mex egg rolls, plus their always tasty and always free multi-gran and sourdough bread is great. But the portions changed. Many no longer on the menu, those that are, bland as hell. Their baja chicken tacos did a 180% and landed on the wrong side of good. Their jambalaya, which used to be my favorite dish is now average at best. Their staff, the clientele, the Chili's-like vibe I get from both the menu, service and food, it is a sad day in chain restaurant world when this happens. Never in a million years would I said I would have preferred Grand Lux to this place, but based on the current trends it's a no brainier. For now on I'm coming here fore apps and cheesecake.

Some locations are better than others and this is one of the better ones!  Service is pretty good and the beef with wasabe mashed potatoes is great.  One time tried the godiva chocolate brownie ice cream sundae - the brownie was so chocolatey it didn't even taste like a brownie but like pure chocolate or a fudge.  Since I was craving an actual brownie that part was kind of disappointing.  But to be honest I would have been happy with just a bowl full of the whipped cream and hot fudge!

It's the Cheesecake Factory, of course it's good!   The menu is ridiculous for both food and drinks. The Apple Martini and JW Pink lemonade are what we usually have besides beer for drinks and are both delicious with just enough alcohol so you know it's there without the drink losing its unique flavour.  The Salmon Fire Cracker rolls, the chicken or beef sliders, and the fire roasted artichoke (da bomb) are our go to appetizers, and never disappoint.  The staff are friendly and attentive, and regardless of how many people are in our party we always have a great time.  This place is great for people of all ages, though if you have more than 4 people in your party, you can expect to wait for a table during peak meal times.

Was out to dinner with my boyfriend, my food was great; HOWEVER hubby had to send his plate back TWICE. First the brown rice was hard so it was sent back for white rice in exchange THEN the whole plate was cold thus sent back for a second time! They made a new dish the third time and it was still subpar. Manager was horrible, I had to eat my dinner without my boyfriend and then he had to eat without me. Least to say, I highly doubt we'll be eating here again.

It's been many years since I dined at The Cheesecake Factory. This location is convenient to my residence; therefore, I decided to try it out. Not bad for leaner eaters since their menu varieties are accommodating. My choice for a Kale & Quinoa salad was an excellent one but it was in a heap-full serving. It's loaded with red bell peppers to punctuate the green to give a colorful mix. The chopped kale was crispy & texturing not bitter with quinoa sticking on the greens, thanks to their light vinaigrette. The halved grapes makes it subtly sweet with lots of shredded cheese to the mountain top. You will love it! I'm a home cook and do lots of authentic American and exotic meals, but this visit got me wanting to go back. Great staff and beautiful ambience. You may wanna check it out if you haven't done so.

We had a really crappy experience. Ate here on a Sunday morning around noon. The meal took us (only two of us) over two hours. I ate a southwest salad which was fine and my fiance had a burger which he enjoyed. Will not be back due to the terrible service and  extremely slow kitchen.

I'd like to first say that Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant. It was my first time at this particular location and as usual, I loved the food decor and the service was exceptional. The main issue I had was the restroom had a horrible odor. I know that some of you might be saying that, it should be expected that it would have an odor but in all my visits to numerous Cheesecake Factories this is the first time this has happened to me. I think this was just an isolated incident and overall I would definitely go back again and I would encourage my friends and family to go also.

I was not impressed with this Cheesecake Factory.  The place was extremely packed and crowded.  The food was at best mediocre and the bread was hard and cold.  First time that I do not really like a Cheesecake Factory location.

The Factory usually has great service. However this location disappointed today. After being seated, it took 5-10 minutes to get water. I mean that's a little excessive, even for a busy restaurant. We're talking water here. Then appetizers and entrees were ordered at the same time, which I thought was a little rushed since we literally just got water. But whatever, we let it slide. What stunk was that I got my salad appetizer after my entree was served. Originally only my side of dressing was delivered and I had to ask what happened to my salad. I do not plan on returning again.

Came here with my girlfriend last night. Everything was perfect, the food, the dessert, and service. Can't complain about one thing. Only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because the waitress poured my glass of wine first when she opened the bottle, instead of filling up the lady's glass first. Other then that...it was an all around great time.

Wow this place was a filthy mess last night.  Floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks.   Our table looked like it gets wiped down regularly with a dirty rag ..the filth was so thick.  A busboy dropped a plate behind us and never came back to clean up the broken glass that was all over the floor.  Food was still good but if the restaurant is so dirty I worry about the kitchen.
One of our family's favorite restaurant. We love the food and the great selection. Price is a bit high but you get what you paid for.

Old Faithful A place that consistently gives great bread, appetizers, dinner and desert should get 5 stars..service is quality also..salad, chicken madeira, lindas, godiva cheesecake, reeses cake, great sunday brunch food too (monte cristo sandwich!), best chain restaurant out.
Favorite place to splurge for an evening out to eat. Elegant atmosphere and the food is wonderful. A bit expensive but there are a few lower price menu items.

i'm not sure that anyone can go wrong with Cheesecake, other than authentic international food it pretty much has everything.  the portions are huge, they are actually meant to be shared by 2 people.  The appetizers are excellent (we constantly get the avocado eggrolls or the tex-mex eggrolls), the entrees are well varied and very tasty, and the desserts... well if you like cheesecakes you'll be in good hands.  I personally am not a huge fan of cheesecakes, too heavy in my opinion, but nonetheless their cakes are very good.  The service is good and the seats are comfortable.  Good atmosphere for eating, but beware that their portions are big so don't pig out because you'll regret it afterwards :)

Thai lettuce wraps!!  I can eat this everyday.  So many different cheesecakes!  The ahi carpaccio is delicious and the Sweet mint green tea is very refreshing. The place is always packed with long lines.  Bit pricey for a chain restaurant.
Packed! And no wifi, or good cell signal to kill the time while you wait. But large food portions, so thats good.

Hamburgers.  This is the only thing that I order here.  The Classic Burger is my ideal of a great American classic.  Why waste time and calories with the inferior versions offered by everyone else?  Real char-broil taste, hefty size... the first bite, a little bit of heaven.  Order the fries super crispy and enjoy. Ok, my wife orders other things and they're pretty good too.  Nice fresh tasting versions of popular Oriental and Mexican dishes.  And we love the wait.  High energy people who love to eat.  It's good to be around folks who take their eating seriously.  Pickers and nibblers need not apply.
excellent menu choices.   great wait staff.  Food is top notch.   atmosphere one of the best Cheesecake Factories.    Wonderful salads, salmon, sliders or casual selections.

For Foodies, it is popular to hate on Cheesecake, but I love the place. Broad fare, consistent quality, large portions, and reasonable pricing render them a no-miss for almost every outing. The cheesecakes are delicious, quite rich, and not at all dessicated like the impostors you get at Barnes & Noble coffee shops. My favorite dish is the Grilled Portobello on a Bun, with mashed potatoes, and topped off with any of their myriad cheesecakes.
This is the way a chain should be run. The food, no matter what is always good. The consistency is there from location to location.  Always happy to eat here.

75% of the time the food and service is great. It's the other 25 where the server doesn't give a crap and you end up with terrible service. Food is good if you choose their go to great classics. Their newer stuff is not that great.
Cheesecake is pretty good when you need somewhere to go and you just don't know what you want.  The food is okay, service is typically so/so.   Skip on drinks to save yourself $3 on a soda.

One of my favorite Restaurant is "The Cheesecake Factory" at the Saw Grass Mall in Sunrise,FL. On August 6th 2010, my husband and I were in Boca Raton, and we decided to try the Cheese Cake Factory on Glades Road. From the point that we sat down, the service was terrible. We were seated at the Bar section, and the waitress, a young girl,  acted as if our table was completely empty. We were waiting for her service for more than10 min without being greeted or even looked at. I asked the manager how much longer we would have to wait for somebody to take our drink order, he said "Oh sure What Do you want?". I said Can you please  at least  bring us the Menus to decide what we want to order...in 5 seconds, like a MIRACLE the waitress appeared with the menu, and the bread. She took the order and we waited another  40 minutes. This is the worst part , the food was terrible!!! So we basically waited long for nothing.   We will still go to the Saw Grass Mall Cheesecake, the service and the food is always great there but I would NEVER go back to this location.
What can I say? It's Cheesecake Factory. It's pretty standard. I'm giving it three stars because of the super long wait times!
as an ex employee service was a little lacking from the standards I remember.

Had big office lunch here, I don't know how they were able to deal with 20+ of us but they did and did it well.  food is the same old same old one more same old too large of portions bland hoping you will forget after you eat desert food.

Tonight was three cheese pasta and chicken salad sandwich. Saving room for cheesecake.  The menu items are all over the place, from burgers and sandwiches to pasta, etc.  Overall, the food has been good each time we have eaten there and the Chessecake is always great!

One of my proudest accomplishments in life was never going to CF... however, when in Rome, errr... South Florida... do as the wife's grandparents do (especially if they are paying). I still can't figure out why so many people want to go to this place. Is it really worth waiting an hour for a table for four? I was definitely surprised with the quality of food, but still not worth the wait. I assume its just a crowd-pleaser because the menu is so diverse that everyone in your party can find something. Here is the breakdown: - Portion Size: Plentiful (on the verge of overkill) - Price: Good bang for your buck - Atmosphere: If you like crowded elevators and Bingo, this is your speed - Service: Spotty... they are probably stretched too thin for the big crowds they cater too... definitely very friendly and knowledgeable though - Food:   - Calamari: nothing special, what you would expect from any average restaurant   - Pour: heavy hand on the whiskey --- no complaints   - Fish Tacos: not sure why they even come standard with albacore, who really wants that type of fish at a restaurant? Saved by the mahi, mahi option. Pretty tasty, nothing special.   - Bread on table: really freakin' good, probably loaded with crack and last but not least...   - Dessert: I think our dessert was called something like Adam's Fudge Nipple, but you probably would be better "served" asking for the Reese's Pieces tasting cheesecake... it is very rich and chocolately... recommended! All in all I can't say this was a bad experience. The food was better than I thought it would be, but I probably would not go back (especially if there is a wait). I might consider stopping in for a piece of that cheesecake though.

Awful service!  I arrived 45 minutes after placing my take out order.  Waited another 30 minutes in my car until the take out waitress came over to my car.  While I waited in my car, I watched while she provided take out orders to cars that arrived after me.  When I finally did receive my order, it was all wrong.  Will not be returning.
Been there a few times.  1. Portions. 2. Quality. 3. Get the heck out of here, the Rene Special is unbelievable.  Can't go wrong there.  9.99 ? So much food.  Some interesting bread selections also.

This place is always packed. Service is ok, food is always good. this is also a good people watching restaurant. check this one out, ya its a chain, and not my 1st pick, but i always get a good meal here.

Cheesecake factory at this location, I'm sure like at most locations, is very busy almost every night but.... you get good service, the food is delicious and the cheesecake is to die for. I always get the choc chip cookie dough! Amazing, amazing, amazing!!

The food is really mediocre. Chef Ramsay would piss on the food if he ever ate there. Very crowded, loud, and service is a hit or miss. The portions are WAY too big for one person. The best thing to have there is the Jamaican shrimp. They don't taste Jamaican at all, but its decent.
The Boca location is always busy and the food and service are always good.  Gigantic menu.  It is hard to find something that doesn't taste good.

3 points for the short wait of only 30 minutes. -2 points for shoving our party of 7 into a tiny corner table in such a way that i had to get up every time someone at the table next to us wanted to get up. at least the food is consistent from location to location. that always amazes me. you can't even find that kind of consistency at mcdonalds.

I have lived in Boca for over 30 yrs. and I have to say ever since this restaurant moved in I have VERY HAPPILY eaten there with friends, family, and guests! Everyone is always impressed with the variety of fresh dishes-which are also incidentally large portions(for 2)! My favorite being the RIB EYE steak and mashed potatoes! Med. rare-the BEST- better than Morton's in Boca even!!  ITs always tender, well-seasoned, and right off the grill! There are even onion rigs on top! As for salads- the french country salad with balsamic dressing is my fave!! For desserts Everything is  marvelous- the chocolate cake with the mini morsels on the side- the Godiva chocolate cheesecake!! yum! To die for ganache! And the dutch apple caramel cheescake -almost like an apple pie!! Even the hot fudge ice cream sundae (that they make!) is just as fabulous! For drinks- Georgia peach and flying gorilla are fun! non- alcoholic beverages such as the peach smoothie or iced mango is great too!
